website_summaries.verdict: If you’ve signed up with a compatible internet provider, this device consistently provides impressively quick internet speed for gaming, web browsing, and video streaming.
pros: Up to 1,000 Mbps for lightning-speed internet
Large number of compatible internet providers
Surprisingly affordable price for top-tier internet speed
cons: Not compatible with some internet providers, including AT&T, Verizon, RCN, etc

customer_reviews.title: Lightening Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I recently (about a month ago) purchased this modem to replace the 100mbps modem provided by Spectrum. We upgraded our service to a 400mbps because we have a gamer in the house plus about 14 connected devices on our wi-if. The MB7621 is rated to provide up to 1000mbps as oppposed to 100mbps that the Motorola SB6141 tops out at. Every speed test I have performed since activating has delivered 375-395mbps. The difference is remarkable! Note: With Spectrum, I had to call them up and lt them activate and register the MB7621. It took maybe 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carr

customer_reviews.title: setup was easy, and over the last few weeks its been ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the MB7621 on an Xfinity Extreme 250 plan (250Mbps down/10Mbps up) as an upgrade from a SB6141. I've consistently seen advertised speeds since installing this modem, setup was easy, and over the last few weeks its been completely reliable with no downtime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: This modem (MOTOROLA MB7621) drops the Internet connection periodically - between several times per day and once per a couple of days days. Don't know what causes this. When it happens, I have to reboot the modem - it does not recover by itself. Contacting my ISP and Motorola Technical support did not help to resolve the problem. The problem was resolved by replacing this modem with ARRIS SURFboard SB6183. No problems with ARRIS so far (after three weeks). Don't know if I got a faulty modem, or it is a firmware bug, or compatibility with my ISP (Optimum). Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: v2005t

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem! Upgraded from the SB6120 after it started ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent modem! Upgraded from the SB6120 after it started dropping connections after 7+ years of use. Quick to get it up and running with Comcast's online activation. The bump in downstream channels was evident from the start, sites (appeared to) load more quickly and Speedtest noted a decent bump in download speed vs. the 6120. Upload is about the same, but that's to be expected. So far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: KMF

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, at least if you're a Altice/Optimum customer
customer_reviews.text: The modem was bought in an attempt to fix frequent disconnects/ping losses I was getting with pos Arris 1602 modem, the only option you get if you are a CV/Altice customer. So after some research, I've bought this device (7621). As the more time passes, the more frequently have to reboot the modem to reconnect to the internet. It could be an issue with lack of compatibility (I doubt it). I'll be opening a Motorolla warranty on it (you have to pay return shipping). May update review with a replacement device. edit: had to put back Arris back in service as Motorolla modem become fully unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few hours
customer_reviews.text: After getting it set up with COX it worked as advertised, things per specs, then the next morning I went from 110Mbs to 10Mbs, lots of chat with COX, they too had slow speeds. Nothing changed from the night before. Many resets, change of cables, nothing. I've run probably 100 speed tests and they are all a mess, some (rare) give me 50Mbs but most are running near 10. Avoid this device, and brand in my opinion. It's a modem, and a review on Newegg had the exact same problem.
customer_reviews.author: GeeBee

customer_reviews.title: This Modem Tripled Our Old Motorola Speeds!
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research on a modem for our Infinity high speed cable. This replaced a surfboard Motorola modem that we had purchased in 2009. The setup was very simple, it hooked right up to our existing Netgear router, and our speed tripled. So far, we're very happy with this purchase. Just a note on buying any modem. The ratings on Amazon can be skewed and all over the place. There is no modem that doesn't have a few bad ratings. Some people have difficulties installing a modem, or making it work, and hop on Amazon and give it a bad rating. Check ratings from tech companies, where you will get non-biased ratings of products.
customer_reviews.author: 999 haunts

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 days...
customer_reviews.text: It worked for exactly 8 days then it died. We wasted 4 hours on the phone with Comcast thinking it was an issue on their end. They finally got a technical supervisor on the phone who, after trying everything else, pulled up the user's manual online and started asking about which lights were lighting up while they were sending a reset. Short answer: all of them stayed lit no matter what. The thing was fried. We sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: L. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Not 1000 Mbps Capable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem in my cord cutting effort with Comcast. The modem is advertised to be certified with Xfiniti and it is. It also says on the packaging and in the listing that it supports 1000+ Mbps. But less than a day after I activated the modem with Comcast, it stopped working. Why? Because according to Comcast, it only supports 800Mbps and was incompatible with my 1000Mbps subscription. My only options are to downgrade my subscription (which stunningly would raise my monthly bill, thanks Comcast), or get a new modem. I am returning the modem now and going with the Netgear CM1000, which Comcast does say is supported on their 1000Mbps plan.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pape

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Installed this as a replacement for a Cox-supplied modem. Setup was easy (had to call Cox to register the new modem) and performance has been very stable on my 100 Mbps link. The modem looks good and runs cooler than most other modems I've used in the past. I usually go for another brand when it comes to routers and modems, but decided to give the Motorola a try and I'm happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Music lover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 500Mb plan
customer_reviews.text: I've had my trusty Motorola SB6120 for 10 years, but recently upgraded from 100Mb to 500Mb with Wow and needed a faster modem. I considered going with a DOCSIS 3.1, but those start at over twice as expensive as this MB7621. Since I only upgraded because of a deal, I opted to try this. A quick 10 minute call and I'm getting the speed I'm paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We just got this to upgrade our Internet for more efficiency during COVID shutdowns. I chose Motorola because our last modem--also Motorola--has worked so well for 15 years, chugging along without issues, that we didn't realize it needed an update until recently. Piece of advice: If you plug it in but your speed doesn't change at all, you may simply need to update your plan with your service provider. We did that, plugged it in to our new Orbi mesh router, and are now enjoying great speed and connections throughout the house. The design looks good, too.
customer_reviews.author: Nerissa

customer_reviews.title: No Issues whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: I have xfinity 175Mb/s connection and with 3 gamers in the house, we have absolutely no issues piping everything through this workhorse. We do receive faster than the 175Mb/s we pay for from time to time, (burst speeds if you will). Download tons of games, streaming movies and songs, Work From Home using Teams with hundreds of people in meetings, Discord, Steam, Origin, multiple smartphones, laptops. This modem does exactly what it's engineers designed it to do! Highly recommended if you do not want to pay the ludicrous rental fee Comcast charges. Get it and quit paying that unnecessary fee!
customer_reviews.author: M. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drops (with brand new infrastructure)
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, this is great when it works, but after a couple weeks, it just drops the connection and requires a reset many times per day. Something worth noting is that I've lived here 2 years, and had virtually zero drops before "upgrading" and Comcast even came out and replaced all the lines all the way to the street to ensure that everything on their end was perfect. The speeds, channel bonding, everything is absolutely perfect, but for whatever reason it needs to be constantly reset. Will be returning (hopefully) and finding another modem. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Weston Winn

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced a Spectrum modem with this one. I can't speak to long term reliability because I've only had it up a few hours. However: * It was activated within a minute of Spectrum sending the signal * Unlike the Spectrum modem, there are multiple indicator lights on the front so you can actually see what's going on. * And of course you have access to the Admin console * Download speeds are identical. However, upload speeds went from 14.5Mbps to 22Mbps. That alone made it worthwhile (along with not having to pay Spectrum to "rent" a modem).
customer_reviews.author: rabinnh

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Easy install for Xfinity Customers. I upgraded from the SB6121 after I found out they increased my speed for free from 150 to 250. My modem couldn’t handle that so this definitely improved it. Even though I’m rated for 250 I peeked out at nearly 315 mbps on both speed test and xfinity speed test. I noticed all 24 download channels work in my area but only 4 upload not 8 but maybe they will update it years to come so I’m future proofed. I was running 4 and now 24 so my network should be smoother by more flow.
customer_reviews.author: Milan

customer_reviews.title: Fast speeds and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Much better than my old modem, an Arris. DG860A. I am getting a bit faster speeds compared to my old modem and I haven't had to restart this one Now I can bump up to 200mb with WOW. My old modem wouldn't be able to handle 200mb too well. Also, this modem was a breeze to set up. Although insignificant to some, I like that it has an on/off switch. Would definitely recommend. Update 7/1/19 Still going strong. Bumped to 200mb and I haven't had to restart once a week like my old modem... Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: This unit self restored after a power and cable interruption
customer_reviews.text: So far this unit has performed flawlessly. It was easy to install and all I had to do was report the MAC address to the cable company. I have 400 Mb internet and it runs well using this modem. UPDATE: I have been experiencing intermittent outages for the last two months. Cable company has been out testing three times and indicates it is the modem. Motorola says I must pay the shipping to return this one and put the new one on my credit card until it is received. That is how they handle your one year warranty. The shipping costs about a third of what I paid for the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Montani

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Spectrum cable in NYC.
customer_reviews.text: Although this cable modem is listed as compatible with Spectrum Cable in NYC, it does not work. I spent several days with Spectrum tech support. I did everything from upgrading my existing internet plan and leaving my grandfathered plan to speaking with 5 different techs. None of them could get the modem to register. You have the ability to try and do it yourself. When you try it tells you that the modem is incompatible. Such a waste of time and to make matters worse I was forced to upgrade to a plan that cut off a chunk of channels in order to get that modem working. Even the Spectrum techs couldn’t understand why it wouldn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Indi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Modem So Far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an old Arris cable modem and I am glad I did. I had difficulty installing it but that was due to my cable company and a bad outside line not the modem. Once they fixed that this modem has worked great. I pay for 100 Mbps download speed and I consistently get 105+ so this is working great. (YMMV because a lot depends on your internet provider and connections). Should I decide to upgrade to a faster Mbps this modem should be able to handle it without a problem. If you are in the market for a cable modem I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: USTPC

customer_reviews.title: Slower than my DOCSIS 2.0
customer_reviews.text: People were not kidding when they said this slowed down their internet speeds. I had a very old Motorola modem installed, DOCSIS 2.0, with just 1 download and 1 upload channel. I thought this DOCSIS 3.0 w/ 24x8 would be a huge upgrade. Boy was I wrong. While the internet speed test most of the time does show 20 MB/s more speed (sometimes it shows 15 MB/s less), in an actual practical web surfing test, the websites load ridiculously slow. I was shopping on Walmart and would literally take me 20 seconds to 1 minute to load the site for each new product I clicked. I re-installed the old modem the same day.
customer_reviews.author: evak

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Motorola modem I have purchased. The first was an MG 7550. It is a combo modem router with great range and has worked flawlessly since I installed it. This second unit is for another location and it (MB 7621) is paired with a Netgear Nighthawk X6S. Both Motorola products are working great. Note that I had already used the Nighthawk with another modem, so I had to reset the Nighthawk for it to work with the Motorola. Yes, that meant I needed to rename my networks again, but that was minor. Once I did that it was an easy set up with the Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice speed improvement
customer_reviews.text: Spectrum cable contract is for 100/10. I have an old Zoom modem, which often got 118/5. Lately, our connection has been unreliable, which ended up being a physical/line problem. Technician, who fixed line issue, suggested I look at upgrading to a Netgear modem. A little research, pointed to me to this modem, Model MB7621. Speeds are now 200+/10+ consistently. Call was required to Spectrum, to place MAC on internet account.
customer_reviews.author: Tertoo

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem for use with Comcast Xfinity Cable internet and it works perfectly as intended. I am only subscribed for a 300 Mbps account and the modem can easily support those speeds on Comcast's network and claims to support up to 1Gbps. The device has been extremely reliable and has not given any issues. A great alternative to renting equipment from your provider after 6-7 months the purchase will have paid for itself assuming you already own your own WiFi Router. Note: Some service providers (Comcast) will need to register your modems MAC Address in order to operate on their network. Make sure you coordinate with their tech support shortly after setting up your modem.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Says this modem is Cox compatible but Cox cannot activate it.
customer_reviews.text: These things are supposed to be simple. You order a modem your ISP says will be compatible. Then you see that Motorola also says this modem is compatible with your ISP. Easy right. I call COX. They "see" my Motorola Modem. I walk through the steps to activate it and......THIS MODEM IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH COX. Cox is confused. After all, the modem is on their list. I'm confused too but then I remember the last Motorola product I owned, A Z2 Force Edition cellphone. I went through two bricked phones before switching to a LG. Well, now I'm switching to NETGEAR. This was the last Motorola product I'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Solid cable modem for Comcast/XFinity customers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Motorola MB7621 cable modem based on its good reviews on Wirecutter. I was paying $14/month to rent a cable modem from Comcast. I did not perceive any problems with my rental Cisco DPC3008 modem, but after upgrading to this newer (and faster) Motorola MB7621 modem I could swear that my internet service is faster, even though the service itself has not changed. The Motorola MB7621 can handle speeds of up to 1000 mpbs. My service level is 100 mbps. To install it I had to call XFinity customer support. It took about 20 minutes before I was up and running.
customer_reviews.author: D.L. Herrington

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, No problems
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older modem that I was renting from my local internet provider with this unit and I have been quite pleased. I've had it two months and it has worked flawlessly. It is more than capable of delivering speeds we are receiving, and has done so consistently. There really isn't much else to say. If I remember, I can update this in a year. I paired it with a TP-Link AC2300 and they have worked really well together. Sometimes I get speeds faster than what I'm paying for on the 5G band.
customer_reviews.author: Stackupguitar

customer_reviews.title: Motorola Modem For The Win!
customer_reviews.text: After the first 6 months, I can safely say that this modem is very top notch for the tier of products in this line! I have recovered very nicely since the garbage, Spectrum-provided Arris modems, which are known for having a defective Intel Puma chip. Kudos to Motorola for making such a high quality product, especially one with a Web-interface for network analysis and troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: Dabney Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great modem- after others would not work.
customer_reviews.text: My ISP is Wow, and I needed to get my own modem and router to prevent paying their rental fees for using their equipment. I bought an ARRIS modem and had issues with the signal dropping, so then I bought a Netgear modem and had the same issue. I was about to give in and use their equipment after all, but after further research it was recommended that Motorola was a good modem for nearly all ISP's. This one worked, no signal losses, good range, it's not the prettiest thing to look at, but it gets the job done. I would recommend this modem to others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product -- Easy to Set-up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem after returning a Netgear modem that was defective and would not lock onto an uplink channel during configuration, including with the assistance of Comcast's tech support sending the proper signals to the devise. After wasting about 2 hours trying to get the Netgear modem to work, this Motorola product was easily set up and working within about 30 minutes. The build quality is also superior to Netgear's plastic cased modems. Modem throughput is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Man

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Sweet.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a cable modem with this. Works great so far. All you have to do is plug it in, screw on the cable wire, plug in the ethernet cable to the wifi router, call cable company with MAC address, and it's done. You may have to power cycle both units for it to finish connecting to wifi, but it's really easy.
customer_reviews.author: George Leroy Tirebiter

customer_reviews.title: Great router that does the job - works with Xfinity in San Jose no problem
customer_reviews.text: Got this router for a house that I rent, and it works great. I subscribed to Xfinity internet with a 200Mbps plan, and hooked up the modem to my Google WiFi Mesh router. After setting it up and running a speed test on my phone, I was able to get 196Mbps with a 7ms ping. Just works, no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Liu

customer_reviews.title: Get a better brand
customer_reviews.text: when the cable company tested my signal just after i got this, there was a substantial signal loss after passing through this modem. 7 months later i had to buy a new cable modem because this one was losing download speed sporadically, dropping down to around 2 mb's per second. i went with a brand that i've had more luck with in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sliver of Life

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Comcast and does not support speeds >300Mbs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the Wirecutter/NYTimes review, which has not steered me wrong before. Despite Motorola saying it is compatible with Comcast, Comcast denies it is compatible with their service, and I cannot get speeds >300Mbs on it. And Motorola Customer Support has me currently on hold for >20 minutes waiting to speak with an agent. Time to return it and buy another modem, five days old...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My modem was outdated which was leading to connectivity issues. I had been putting off upgrading since installing my original one. This one installed incredibly easily. It installed quickly (on comcast) over the internet without any need to make any calls to anyone. It probably took 5 minutes. It works very well and I no longer have the connectivity issues I was having.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: You must call xfinity to activate this modem!
customer_reviews.text: I wasted almost 2 hours first troubleshooting this modem, then calling xfinity. Well turns out they have to activate the modem and will need to MAC id (on box) before it will work. No where in the manual does it say this. What a colossal headache just to replace a modem. Then to top it off I still don't get any faster speeds and far short of the service I'm paying for. To clarify, I think the modem is fine but comcast service is terrible
customer_reviews.author: mtn rider

customer_reviews.title: Is NOT compatible with Spectrum 400Mb service..
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but felt I should, so that others were at least aware. According to the product description this modem is compatible with Spectrum services. After buying it and going through set up, turns out it isnt (at least for us in SoCal). It isnt on the approved list (see screenshots) so cant be activated. Having to return and find alternative. I'm giving one star for listing accuracy, I can't comment on functionality as never got to use it.
customer_reviews.author: SA Bell

customer_reviews.title: great, added 100 megabits per sec
customer_reviews.text: Have 300 megabits per sec service and with 5 year old cable modem was getting about 252mbps. Now I'm getting 360mbps. Setup was easy, I left my network switch and separate router/wifi wiring alone hoping not to mess with the cables -- being lazy, but even with two hops, it fully activated in about 15 or 20 mins, everything was operational. Most of that time was waiting for the provider to automatically mess with the modem. I'm getting all channels down and locked. Only four channels (of the 8) up with a speed of 12mbps. I think I used Chrome to initiate activation, but not sure, as I have Firefox, too (each with different security settings.)
customer_reviews.author: D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Up and running in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have all the specs and securities, but know I wanted to avoid a modem with the faulty chip causing latency. I unboxed, removed my 7nyrsr old modem, plugged this in, when to motorola.com, signed into my Xfinity account, and was good to go - all within 5 minutes. Speeds went from 150 (max capacity of old modem) to 300 mbps. Happy I'm fully utilizing what I'm paying for and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Stable, easy to install, works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this modem! The picture quality when watching Netflix (via apple TV) is noticeably better with just switching to this new modem. Installation was super easy with pictures and easy to understand instructions (very few steps). TIP: if you are changing both your modem and router, start by changing out just one of them. Then, after things work, change the other one. I found that using this method, I did the setup for a new router and modem in about 20 minutes total with zero technical issues. In years past, I tried switching out both at the same time and that really caused time, headache, and problems...costing several hours of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Irina Chukhray

customer_reviews.title: noticeable difference right away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem because I was tired of spending a rental fee with my internet provider. I set it up in about 10 min, ran a speed test and I went from 80mb to 160mb over wifi (with Asus wifi router that was also used with rental modem). So frustrated that I haven't been getting that speed with the rental modem even though it was supposed to be able to handle up to 300mb. I wish I would have made the switch years ago. even if I have to upgrade in a year to 3.1, I would still save $100 in rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: OregonDucks

customer_reviews.title: Not for Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this for use on Xfinity. I worked for about a day then began dropping out, then started dropping out 2-3 times a day. This was my second modem the did not play well with Xfinity. Buy yourself a DOCSIS 3.1 and Google Xfinity compatible modems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Remsnyder

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, just call your provider to activate
customer_reviews.text: Used this modem to replace the Spectrum provided modem. The modem works great and I have my Google WiFi connected to replace the Spectrum wireless router. Returned the Spectrum modem and wireless router back to Spectrum and will save on lease fees!
customer_reviews.author: North Star

customer_reviews.title: Good bye Moto!
customer_reviews.text: The modem made me long for the days of dial up internet, when you knew your internet was connecting, when your heard the sounds of young robots being tortured. They called this a hand-shake, but I can assured you, YES robots were harmed making your connection. But on a side note: Dropped internet multiple times a day, and the lights would not indicated any difference. Replaced with an Arris manufactured modem and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Malloy

customer_reviews.title: Working great and saving money!
customer_reviews.text: Install was a breeze. Due to local cable company's (Wave Broadband) requirements, I needed to keep their eMTA for my phone service (but they the waive the rental fee for it when the customer has their own modem). I knew the cable signal was good at modem connection so I just installed a 2-way splitter in line feeding old eMTA and new modem. Waited about a half hour and called Wave to activate. Gave rep a couple numbers from new modem, they provisioned new modem for internet and took internet off of eMTA. Entire phone call took under 5 minutes and modem is working great since then and I'm saving about $12 a month by having my own modem!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research prior to buying this model and it appears to have done me good. Set up was very easy and my signal strength is strong when set up with my google wifi. The box itself isn’t obtrusive but I have it hidden behind my couch so that isn’t a concern of mine. I like how many holes are in the outside case so there’s little concern for over heating. All in all, this has been a good choice so far!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Cain

customer_reviews.title: Plug N Play is still a thing, With Motorola.
customer_reviews.text: Motorola has consistently provided the most stable electronics since I can remember. The MB7621 Cable Modem fits perfectly into my ISP and home Router with ease. The price is just right for any budget and guess what? I am sure I will never need another cable modem for the next 5-10 years...Well...up until we get WiFi chips installed on our body. (Buy it and Forget it!)
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Cable modem that does what it’s supposed to do. I get about 650Mbps down which is my rated speed from Comcast after upgrading to this from an older one that maxed out around 250. During activation, make sure you connect directly to it from your pc and set your pc to dhcp if you are using a static IP. After being told by Xfinity that the hardware was bad or there was a network issue I tried this and all worked ok. Knew it wasn’t hardware or network as all was fine before with the older modem. Hopefully it lasts problem free for a number of years like my old one did.
customer_reviews.author: spetasal

customer_reviews.title: It works perfect
customer_reviews.text: The installation was very easy. I had Comcast modem/router before and I also have good Linksys router purchased 3+ years back which was sitting there idle. I have total of 20+ devices connected to internet. To make the transition easy I attach Linksys router to Comcast modem/router so I have both routers active. I then move all my devices over to Linksys wireless router from Comcast wireless router followed by replacing Comcast modem/router with Motorola modem and Linksys router. Overall it was very smooth transition. New motorola modem/Linksys router combination seems working better than Comcast modem/router. I also get to save $10 monthly going forward. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Great speeds.  No reboots yet.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our Comast modem with this. We get the same wired speeds with this as we did with our Comcast one. After 11.5 months, it will pay for itself. I don't know why we did not do this sooner. No reboots yet. UPDATE: We attempted to upgrade our Comcast to gigabyte speed and this router could not handle it. Beyond disappointed. So it works great now 5 months later, but it does not work with Comcast gigabyte. Just terrible false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: G. Eberly

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optimum Online
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the modem I leased for years from Optimum Online. I was having random loss of internet after installing this and also a new TP-Link router, but the lights and signal on and from the router where constant and stable as they should be. I changed the DNS on my router to 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4, and after a few days, everything seems working as it should and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Not approved by Charter Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this just 1 star based on false advertising. The description states that this modem is compatible with charter spectrum but it is actually not.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good Modem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to "modernize" my internet connection. Any modem is better than the crap that the cable company gives you. The modem came with the ethernet cable and power supply for hookup, and a tiny wrench to use to tighten down the coax. Install went without a hitch on my end, just call the cable company and have them authorize it to your account... if the tech you get can figure that out then it just works. I used this modem with MediaCom (in the midwest).
customer_reviews.author: JWM

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem for Xfinity!
customer_reviews.text: I was advised by Xfinity that I needed a new modem because my 10-year old Motorola Surfboard SB6120 wasn't fast enough for the increased speeds in my neighborhood. I purchased the Motorola MB7621. It was delivered in a day. I swapped out the coax from the old modem to the MB7621 and called Xfinity to give them the new MAC address and serial number. Definite speed increase, (almost) plug and play with Xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: Wine Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Rated best 3.0 Modem by  Wirecutter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and handles high speeds under 1 gigabyte. Biggest disappointment is that it has only 1 Ethernet port to connect to your WiFi router. ( it does not have WiFi). However you can then connect your WiFi router to a switch. I used an inexpensive ($15) 5 port switch and it worked perfectly. Now getting strong WiFi signal where I was not before. No drop in speed so far and no continual dropping of signal. Just used it for 2 days so will have to wait and see. The other caveat is that I hooked up a new Mesh system but before I did I got a stronger signal from my old system.
customer_reviews.author: Don k

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: We got this to replace a modem we thought was acting up as we kept loosing signal (wifi router never cut out but no internet.) Spectrum told us it was probably the modem. NOPE Worthless Spectrum internet service was to blame. We still have issues. Spectrum denies it is there problem, but they are sending out a tech when they can. Amazing enough since they put in a service ticket the issue went away. So this modem is great and works very well. We are getting Max speed on this and no issues with overheating. Very pleased with this modem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This work well, unfortunately its the cable companies that stink. It to five phone calls to Spectrum to A determined that my old router was stuck at 10Mbs, purchased this and they gave me 400Mbs at a higher cost than the 200 is was quoted. Spectrum finaly gave up and gave me 400Mbs at the 200Mbs price. The router work great, Spectrum and AT&T stink. Go Skylink
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Despite Glowing Reviews, My Purchase Was a Fizzle
customer_reviews.text: Unlike virtually everyone else who's reviewed, my experience with this modem wasn't good. I purchased the modem based on its glowing reviews, & upon attaching it to the cable, the globe icon never stopped blinking. I tried unhooking, re-attaching, unplugging the power, etc., & nothing happened. (The "globe" light never stopped blinking.) The cable internet company sent out a technician who measured the incoming signal strength to the modem, & determined it was simply a defective modem. No point calling Motorola for support, since I couldn't connect to the internet. Likewise, no point getting an identical replacement. (I replaced it with another brand, which worked immediately.) I returned to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: I upgrade the internet speed to 150M, so I bought this one to replace my old one. But I only got 50M download speed from this modem; I could get 85m download speed from my old one. After I rebooted the modem, I could not even connect to the internet. I put my old modem back, it worked immediately.
customer_reviews.author: NSJ

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with product and speeds
customer_reviews.text: For the record, I replaced an older modem. I have Comcast cable and the online activation did not work for me, which meant I had to place a call to Comcast tech support. Once I pressed 0 on my phone's keypad a million times, I was able to speak to a live human and was able to successfully activate the modem without incident. I haven't noticed any degradation in performance. I ran several speed tests, using several different sites and the results were all similar. Other than online activation failing, which is probably Comcast's fault, I am very happy with this purchase. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Hill

customer_reviews.title: Motorola fan forever
customer_reviews.text: I worked at two different Fire departments for over 32 years before retiring and both departments relied on Motorola communications equipment. I witnessed a portable Motorola radio fall from an aerial ladder truck from a height of approximately 40 feet onto a paved surface and keep on working as if nothing had happened. This modem was a simple plug and play. The only thing I had to do was activate it through Comcast online. Took about three or four minuted and never looked back. Great product from a great company. In my opinion, you can't go wrong with Motorola. After all, I trusted my life with their products for over 32 years. P.S. This modem runs super cool !
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Zoom is Motorola now?
customer_reviews.text: It works reliably so far. My only concern is the onboard coax surge protection, since my previous modem (Zoom) burned during a recent lightning storm and it was traced to the incoming coax line (all electric runs through proper surge protection.) I cannot use external coax surge protectors due to the negative impact they have on broadband data. In their defense, the Zoom lasted 3yrs through numerous storms, and they stand by their equipment (while under warranty) so in the end it is still cheaper than leasing subpar equipment from the thieves supplying the internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this XFINITY approved unit to replace my old XFINITY modem which was working ok, but had very occasionally drops. The Motorola version was just a total fail. Working for 5 minutes, dead for 10 minutes, working for 3 minutes, dead for 6 minutes, etc. When I put my XFINITY modem back in everything was stable again, so its definitely not the service. Unfortunately due to COVID chaos I wasn't able to deal with this fast enough so my return window closed. So I'm left with a $78 door stop which is going e-waste as soon as it opens again. Don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: holamateo

customer_reviews.title: Looking for reliable speed? You found it.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 5 year old Motorola modem with a peak download of 175Mbps. My service is rated for 300Mbit. After calling xfinity and adding the modem to my account, I plugged my laptop directly into the modem and ran a speed of.me test. I hit a download of 375Mbps! This is a night and day difference over my old modem. NZB downloads at a sustained 32MB/s. This router says it can handle gigabit WAN, so if xfinity gets its s#%t together and offers faster speeds, this modem should handle it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Carilli

customer_reviews.title: works with comcast
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an old modem, same brand. Works as expected; there are not many functionalities to set to be honest, but you can access the few ones available from the web interface (192.168.1.1). Not sure if this is getting up to 1000MBPS since my plan cover 200MBPS, and I get the advertised speed when the network conditions allows it.
customer_reviews.author: CFTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to renting from Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: It is good to not have to pay Comcast outrageous rent for modem. Will pay for itself in 8 months. Signal seems good although may get some throttling of signal since we no longer rent from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Motorola IT hardware for years. Definitely the best bang for your buck. Im getting 260 out of my 300 plan from Cox. You need a better one if you’re going with a gigabit plan anytime soon. I dont see myself doing that as I am usually only in the house with 3 people max. They’re really easy to setup but if you get a technician from cox that doesnt know what they’re doing it’ll take forever. Luckily she hung up and I got a new technician. Activated my modem, instant setup after that.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, some odd issues
customer_reviews.text: Modem was shipped without a shipping box....it was shipped in its shrink wrapped packaging and nothing more...which was a bit odd. After hooking it up Charter would not recognize hardware as Motorola but as some odd off brand product and would not connect to it. After getting charter support on the phone, they were able to recognize the model of the hardware and remote enable it confirming that its max download speed is around 400 mb/s which seemed low. So far performance has been solid so I hope that is the worst of it.
customer_reviews.author: WanderLust

customer_reviews.title: Seven Months, RIP
customer_reviews.text: Performed flawlessly for nearly seven full months. Then dead. Given the cost of renting a modem from the ISP, I've just about broken even on this. Previously had a Netgear modem that worked more than 10 years -- and was still working when I retired it to "update" my technology!
customer_reviews.author: Free Heat

customer_reviews.title: I have two of these modems. They are both dead.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these modems. They both have died of the same issue; being connected to the ISP, but unable to pass the signal to any devices. The diagnostics page doesn't even show up (192.168.100.1) when plugged into it directly. The LED's all show nominal when the dropouts happen. I'm currently trying to reach Motorola to get a replacement as this second one is within warranty, but I'll probably buy a different brand either way
customer_reviews.author: Tao Tien

customer_reviews.title: Wave Broadband
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace rented equipment from ISP only to find that it would connect momentarily then drop connection constantly and could not communicate with TP-Link AC1900 Wi-Fi Router. I have Wave Broadband HS250 and was looking to upgrade from the 8X4 channel modem they provided to this 24X8 channel but experience constant connection problems. This is supposed to be a compatible modem but was not. I had to go back to the rented modem, which works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for Modem
customer_reviews.text: Edit 8/10/20: down to 4 stars. Apparently original unit was faulty after a month of connection issues. Xfinity said they could not get a good signal off of it, whatever that means. Im not entirely convinced but Amazon did honor and sent a new unit. Will try and update after another month. Orignal: Please dont rent one, its super easy to use your own. Installed with Xfinity. Can technically support 1GB/s, but rated for up to their 600Mbps plan. No Intel Puma chipset.
customer_reviews.author: la.ghost

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: When my old modem (8X4) died I upgraded to this one (24X8 although with my cable service I'm only getting 24x4). I've had good luck with Motorola in the past so stayed with what I know. The quick start installation instructions seem geared to those people who get the modem from the cable company as they assume that your ISP already has the MAC address - when you cut costs and buy the equipment yourself, they DON'T (you have to call customer support).
customer_reviews.author: tlbrad774

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: For some strange reason this modem has some of the highest ratings from many different evaluators ( such as PC Mag). Maybe I just received a lemon, but the unit keeps resetting sometimes several times a day. The speed varies from 200+Mb/sec to 10 (or less)MB/sec. Streaming (such as Netflix) is not possible because the bandwidth is just too low. It is most unfortunate that I cannot return or exchange it for a different unit. My advice to you- keep looking for a better model.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Mazzotta

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and more
customer_reviews.text: I was paying $212/ year for rental from my service provider for their modem. This one is every bit as good and I'm very please with the performance. There was a glitch on my part when installing it. I installed the modem using my old cable from the modem to the router. WRONG. It didn't give me but half my speed that I was paying for. THEN I replaced my old cable with the one that came with the modem and WOW the speeds jumped up and it is preforming exceptional. Very good modem.
customer_reviews.author: Fast Fred

customer_reviews.title: This product did not work with Xfinity service
customer_reviews.text: I installed this modem per the instructions and through the Xfinity portal. It worked great at first, but after about an hour the internet stopped working. I called Xfinity and they did a firmware update (I think) which took about 40 min. Then I rebooted and the modem worked again for about an hour, then it froze up again. Xfinity was not able to solve the issue over the phone without a service call so I had to return the modem. Per online reviews, customer feedback, etc. I opted for the ARRIS Surfboard (16x4) DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem, Approved for Cox, Spectrum, Xfinity & More (SB6183 Black). Hopefully that one will work better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and fast
customer_reviews.text: Second Motorola modem. Both worked perfect out of the box. Just called Spectrum, gave MAC address waited about a minute. Everything worked just right after about a minute and a reboot. Spectrum just bumped the basic network speed to 200mbps. With the added speed and growing number of devices, it was nice to upgrade to this new modem. 24/8 makes the devices work faster and smoother. Streaming 4K was smooth and fast. Thank you Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Sharkee

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible
customer_reviews.text: Incompatible running over Cox with Netgear Nighthawk model R7000 wireless router. I believe there is a firmware or other compatibility issue. The modem loses connection and has to be restarted multiple times a day. I strongly do NOT recommend attempting to use this modem over Cox networks with this router. I went back to the ARRIS CM8200 which now runs perfectly with my router and Cox.
customer_reviews.author: Azuregryphon

customer_reviews.title: it works but could be packaged better
customer_reviews.text: This modem replaces a several year old surfboard modem. The surprising thing is that this new modem is twice as big as the old one, but appears to have 1/2 the circuitry inside it. I can only assume Motorola is using the same case for modems, modem-router and modem-router-phone combos and is trying to save on tooling costs. Great for them, but a minus for the end user. So I'm taking off a star for final product packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DiTullio

customer_reviews.title: Replaced cable company's gear
customer_reviews.text: We've always used the modem from the cable company, but at a $10 fee per month we decided to switch to owning our own, especially since we were finding it necessary to restart the old modem about once a week. This modem was not as easy to install as advertised - it took a call to the company and we found that we had to call the cable company to finish installation. Once it was installed, though, we've had no issue. Great signal and we haven't had to reset the box since switching over. When we had trouble with installation, Motorola was easy to work with!
customer_reviews.author: KnitGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good solid modem and easy to install on Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Modem installed quickly on my Comcast Xfinity system. seems to be quicker than my old surfboard 6121. Lost connection frequently on my surfboard. Going on one week strong and have not lost signal yet on this new Motorola modem. Price seems fair for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: ProWax

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Speed significantly slowed down to 32 mbps. Just going to keep my rental modem from Xfinity. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: A snap to install and now I quit paying for a modem, over and over and over again.
customer_reviews.text: Easy peasy! I bought the modem. When it got here I disconnected the rental modem from Xfinity and took both of them to the Xfinity Sore. They took the rental modem and stored it. They removed the monthly rental charge. They registered the Motorola and activated it. I took it home and unboxed it. I connected the appropriate connections. And, just like that I was up on my new modem. BTW, I use third-party, commercial grade wifi equipment too, because I am a software developer. But, don't take that as an invitation to ask detailed network questions. I am NOT a network guy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hawkinson

customer_reviews.title: Cox cable could not activate this modem
customer_reviews.text: I spent 2 hours with cox trying to activate this modem.Cox told me the serial number is not one issued by Motorola and the serial number is not in the format for the MB7621.Cox then told me the signal was sent to the modem but the modem couldn't read it.They concluded that the factory printed a serial number that did not match the modem. I hope Motorola see's this because something is wrong with the manufacturing process. Cox says they have never seen anything like this and says the chip may be defective I received this modem in a plastic sealed box and it was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: scuba777

customer_reviews.title: Issues since purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have to reset the device multiple times throughout the day. I am only running 3-4 WiFi devices in my home so it is not over worked. These issues occurred right away, then stopped for 30 days and now is back to frequent resets. I purchased another router and it is working perfectly so I think it’s safe to say it is not my internet provider or my nest system. Such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lionel Tommasiello

customer_reviews.title: Does not come near 1gb speeds
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is a great modem and installation is a breeze. I hooked it up with comcast xfinity the 1GB package. It's very affordable at less than $100 for a Gb modem. Unfortunately it does not go any faster than 470mbps download. The ad states 1000mbps but it comes far short of that speed. My Comcast Xfinity package is 1000mbps and according to the tech, the fastest over copper wire he's seen in my neighborhood is 800mbps. So this modem should be able to attain those speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the refurbished models
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally to replace my 5-year Netgear modem/router combo. Spent over 3.5 hours with my ISP and Motorola tech support without any progress, due to constant errors trying to establish a connection with my ISP. Ended up returning it, and decided to give it one more shot, due to its positive reviews. The replacement worked immediately, and off I went. For future buyers, be wary of what Amazon sends you. Turns out the first model was a refurbished one with a "sealed sticker" that made it seem it was new, contrary to actual results.
customer_reviews.author: Tudor

customer_reviews.title: Saved myself $40!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This modem looks brand new! There's one small faint mark on one side that's only noticeable if you look for it. It came with everything that would be in the "brand new" box, power cord, ethernet cable, and instructions. I hooked it up in 15 minutes and it works perfectly with no issues! I Will update if it fails anytime soon but I doubt it will. Buy it at this price, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: R. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, fast and economical cable modem
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Motorola Sb6121 4X4 cable modem for last 6 years which have easily saved me almost $700 of modem rental fees from my cable provider. I am very satisfied with my current modem but decided to upgrade it with a newer model. I had to make a quick call to my cable provider and after providing them with MAC-ID of new modem, my new modem SB7621 24X8 was up are running in no time. This DOCSIS 3.0 modem support speed up to 1000mbps with most cable providers. But with comcast Xfinity, this modem only support speed up to 600mbps. So, look for DOCSIS 3.1 modem if your Xfinity internet service is higher than 600mbps.
customer_reviews.author: ZB

customer_reviews.title: unstable
customer_reviews.text: its giving me alot of issue after 5 month of use, it work if it wanted to work
customer_reviews.author: Li S

customer_reviews.title: Great device for money if you have plan up to 1 GB speed
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded service and needed a new modem. This thing was the right price. Already had a separate router and hate paying rental fees. Purchased this hooked it up and boom I instantly went from 150 mbps to over 500 which is what I had upgraded to. I believe it makes around a gig. I'd probably get a different one if I was going to hit GB speed but for anything under this is great for the money
customer_reviews.author: Shuoink

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the modem provided by my cable company sucked. It had to be rebooted a lot, and I wasn't getting the speed I'm paying for. It got this, and it's made a world of difference. It's easy to set up, and all you have to do is call your cable ISP and give them the MAC address to enable it. I'm now getting my speed and no more bottlenecks on my 4k streaming! I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: theosuperstar

customer_reviews.title: Working well so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the comcast router/modem combo for which comcast kept on raising rental fees (nowadays it is around $14 I think). It has been 4 months and so far I have had no issues. You will need a wifi router to go along with this cable modem so that is something to consider. For me, I opted for google nest wifi to create a mesh and got full coverage for the house (2000+ sqft)
customer_reviews.author: ZK

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable modem because the price was right for the speed I need, and so far I'm not disappointed. I'm getting 230 Mbps down when I'm only paying for 200. So that's nice. This is my first experience buying my own cable modem, so I don't really know what to expect in terms of longevity, but I imagine they should become obsolete in terms of speed delivered before they actually crap out. I hope this one works for at least 5-7 good years, and I'll be sure to come back and update this review if it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E

customer_reviews.title: MB7621 keeps disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: The first device I received from Amazon had problems out of the box immediately. Within a week I had it replaced with an identical product. The first day or two this item worked well. After this my router would lose connection once a day. Slowly it began dropping internet numerous times a day, to the point where it drops internet at least 5-10 times a day and a hard reset requires a reconnect. It's making very hard to work from home during these times. I'm very disappointed in this product and wish I went with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Wants & Wishes

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: After hours of reading reviews and tech information on MB7621 I ordered this modem to replace my cable rental one with xfinity. Internet was up fast, but had trouble registering the equipment and a quick phone call took care of that with xfinity support. Easy set up with router as well Netgear AC1200. As others stated in these reviews speed was evident from the start even with local heavy traffic after I performed several speed tests, phone, lap top wife and connected ethernet as well. All browser news and sports sites came up fast with no video buffering I was accustomed to. If in need of a modem this one so far is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to changing my modem to reduce the monthly charge, with the help of tech support from Wave. this unit received NO lights lighting up when plugged into a regular outlet, the first step in installing. It is a faulty unit. I went to WalMart and bought a new modem and router. The new modem did not work either. Went back and exchanged it for a unit containing both and THAT one finally worked. The Motorola was recommended by tech support from my cable company.
customer_reviews.author: Bev M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cable modem.
customer_reviews.text: So far this modem has been working great. Was looking for a Comcast and RCN compatable simple cable modem with upstream and downstream channels and this seemed to fit the requirements I needed. No issues thus far, haven't had any drops in service that required rebooting the modem. And when turned on it seems to connect with my Comcast service pretty quickly (within a minute). Modem was easy to setup as well. Also the modem plays nice with my Asus Router running Advanced Tomato custom firmware. It's irrelevant, but I also like the color scheme of the status LEDs. I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Hr Narragansett

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace my old modem, which was no longer supported and incapable of utilizing the full capacity of a recently-upgraded 300mbps connection. So far it works as well as you'd expect of a cable modem, which is to say it hasn't failed yet and doesn't require constant resets. Speed test results show it is capable of the maximum speed of my internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I was able to quickly activate this modem with RCN (250 Mbps service). This modem had been in use with no problems for ~2 months and I get the speed I was getting with the company provided modem. This thing will pay for itself in about 8 months thanks to the rental savings. Had previously used the 8x4 version of this modem for years with RCN and Optimum with no problems (had to replace because new place needed a 16 channel down modem at the minimum). I expect the same life span from this one.
customer_reviews.author: JB

product_meta.title: Motorola 24x8 Cable Modem, Model MB7621, DOCSIS 3.0. Approved by Comcast Xfinity, Cox, Charter Spectrum, Time Warner Cable, and More. Downloads 1,000 Mbps Maximum (No WiFi)
feature_bullets: Model MB7621 is recommended for actual cable Internet service speeds up to 650 Mbps. Wirecutter rates this “the best modem for most people.” A Full-Band Capture Digital Tuner ensures faster, more reliable Internet.

This cable modem's one Gigabit Ethernet port connects to a WiFi router, computer, HDTV, game station, or streaming video device. Great for use with Whole Home WiFi or Mesh networks like eero, Google WiFi, and Orbi. (This cable modem does not have a built-in wireless router or telephone call capability. The Motorola MG7315, MG7540, MG7550, and MG7700 have a built-in wireless router.)

Requires cable Internet service.Approved by and for use with Comcast Xfinity and Xfinity X1, Cox, Charter Spectrum, Time Warner Cable, BrightHouse, CableOne, SuddenLink, RCN, and other cable service providers. ELIMINATE CABLE MODEM RENTAL FEES UP TO 156 DOLLARS PER YEAR.(Savings are shown for Xfinity and vary by cable service provider. No cable modem is compatible with fiber optic, DSL, or satellite services from Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, Frontier, and others. Model MB7621 has no phone jack.)
Setup is fast and easy using the Quick Start guide. Experienced USA-based Motorola customer support specialists are happy to help if you need them. Support is in English or Spanish.

Attractive, compact design minimizes shelf space, improves cooling, and extends product life while looking great in any home or office. A two-year warranty plus rugged lightning and power surge circuits protect your investment. Includes phone and web support by friendly, professional USA-based technical support specialists.
